intro: Mussaenda microdonta subsp. odorata, commonly known as the sweet-scented Mussaenda, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that range in color from white to pink. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. The subspecies is noted for its fragrant flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
